sentences.english: They can nest up to eight times in a season, producing up to 800 eggs.
sentences.chinese: 一季中，它們可以上岸8次，產卵多達800枚。

sentences.english: The adult likes to lay eggs in the exocuticle of the receptacle.
sentences.chinese: 成蟲喜產卵於巳開放之花朵的花托外表皮內。

sentences.english: Guided by their sense of smell, they will return in a few years to  spawn.
sentences.chinese: 在其嗅覺的指引下，幾年後它們會回到這裏產卵。

sentences.english: Sandhill cranes lay their eggs in the northern state of Wisconsin.
sentences.chinese: 沙丘鶴在威斯康新州北部產卵。

sentences.english: A female stinkbug lays 300 to 400 eggs at a time, and dies after the eggs are laid.
sentences.chinese: 一隻雌蠋蝽每次產卵三百至四百粒，產後便死去。

sentences.english: The catfish deposits its eggs in shallow water, generally dose to roots or close to reeds .
sentences.chinese: 鮎魚通常在葦根或葦幹附近的淺水裏產卵。

sentences.english: The females use their ovipositor to bore into the bark.
sentences.chinese: 雌蜂用其產卵器鑽入樹皮。

sentences.english: Such papillae are characteristic of most demersal spawning species.
sentences.chinese: 如此的乳突是大多數的底棲產卵種的特徵。

sentences.english: The platypus and the echidna are egg-laying mammals.
sentences.chinese: 鴨嘴獸和針鼴是產卵哺乳動物。

sentences.english: In the wild, females build nests by digging tunnels and chambers in the soil, in which they lay their eggs.
sentences.chinese: 在野外，雌性靠在土裏挖穴建巢，她們將在這裏產卵。

sentences.english: A parasitic wasp settles inside a Ficus insipida fig tree fruit to lay its eggs.
sentences.chinese: 一隻寄生蜂正在無花果樹的果實中產卵。

sentences.english: On average, a femal moth lays 2623 eggs.
Green and loggerhead turtles return to this sandy beach each year to lay their eggs.
sentences.chinese: 每年，綠海龜和蠵龜都會回到這裏的沙灘產卵。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, resection of Eyestalk can also promote pre- spawning.
sentences.chinese: 同時，切除眼柄，也能促進克氏原螯蝦提早產卵。

sentences.english: The platypus is one of the only two existing egg- laying mammals in the world.
sentences.chinese: 鴨嘴獸是世界上僅存的兩種產卵哺乳動物之一。

sentences.english: The fecundity of an adult is very great (the highest reaches 1701 eggs).
sentences.chinese: 成蟲繁殖力強，最高產卵量可達1701粒。

definition: (bird species of China) black-faced spoonbill (Platalea minor)
to fish for (aquatic animals and plants)/to catch
population (of a species)/community (of animals or plants)
reptiles/also written 爬行類|爬行类
imago (adult, sexually mature insect, the final stage of its development)
mammals/also written 哺乳動物|哺乳动物
